title: hESC-beta and diabetes human insulin in mice 2

content.question: Which of the following conclusions is best supported by the data presented in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: Mouse β-cells are more effective than implanted hESC-β cells at regulating blood glucose levels.
Implanted hESC-β cells are effective at regulating blood glucose levels in the absence of mouse β-cells.
Mouse b-cells do not regulate blood glucose levels in the presence of implanted hESC-β cells.
Implanted hESC-β cells cause type 1 diabetes in laboratory mice.

content.answer: Implanted hESC-β cells are effective at regulating blood glucose levels in the absence of mouse β-cells.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
